title: Gary Kirsten

coverImage.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic license.

summary: Gary Kirsten is a former South African cricketer. He was also the coach of the Indian cricket team that won the 2011 world cup.

value.label: Left arm opening batsman and right arm off-break bowler

value.label: Gary Kirsten is a left-handed opening batsman, and a right arm off-break bowler.
Kirsten made his international debut in a ODI versus Australia in 1993
The Australia national cricket team is the joint oldest team in Test cricket history, having played in the first ever Test match in 1877.

value.label: Kirsten scored 188 not-outagainst the United Arab Emirates during the 1996 World Cup

The 1996 Cricket World Cup, also called the Wills World Cup 1996 after its official sponsors, ITC's Wills brand, was the sixth Cricket World Cup. It was the second World Cup to be hosted by Pakistan and India, and for the first time by Sri Lanka.

value.label: The South African national cricket team, nicknamed the Proteas is administered by Cricket South Africa. South Africa is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One Day International (ODI) and Twenty20 International (T20I) status.

value.label: Western Province is the team representing Western Cape province in domestic first-class cricket in South Africa.
